sentence.Network_en: I had a monumental run-in with him a couple of years ago.
sentence.Network_cn: 几年前，我和他大吵了一架。

sentence.Network_en: It had been a monumental blunder to give him the assign-ment.
sentence.Network_cn: 当时把这项任务给他是大错特错了。

sentence.Network_en: This book is a monumental work worthy of China's new cultural movement.
sentence.Network_cn: 这部著作不愧为中国新文化运动的丰碑.

entry.def: You can use monumental to emphasize the size or extent of something.

example.ex: It had been a monumental blunder to give him the assignment.
example.tran: 当时把这项任务给他是大错特错了。

entry.tran: (书或音乐)丰碑式的，意义深远的，不朽的
entry.def: If you describe a book or musical work as monumental, you are emphasizing that it is very large and impressive, and is likely to be important for a long time.

example.tran: 他关于中国天文学的不朽巨著

entry.def: A monumental building or sculpture is very large and impressive.

example.ex: I take no real interest in monumental sculpture.
example.tran: 我对高大的雕塑没什么兴趣。

means.word_mean: 1. relating or belonging to or serving as a monument;

sentences.sentence: "the use of the arch in monumental architecture"

means.word_mean: 3. imposing in size or bulk or solidity;

auth_sentence.content: The ecological implications of all that are just monumental.

作为纪念碑的; 纪念碑上的(仅用于名词前)
非常大(或好、坏、蠢等的）（仅用于名词前）

sentences.en: It was a case of monumental bad-manners.
